obfuscation: ﻿ THE CAPITAL PUNISHMENT IS NEVER RIGHT !
original: ﻿ THE CAPITAL PUNISHMENT IS NEVER RIGHT!

obfuscation: Since the beginning of time the strong ones has oppressed the weak ones .
original: Since the beginning of time the strong ones has oppressed the weak ones.

obfuscation: It has not constantly been considered a crime to kill or torture a human being .
original: It has not always been considered a crime to kill or torture a human being.

obfuscation: But the time changes and thus do mankind .
original: But the time changes and so do mankind.

obfuscation: This barbarian means became less usual and the killing were considered illegal .
original: This barbarian way became less usual and the killing were considered illegal.

obfuscation: The struggle against capital punishment have been successful but only 100 of the worlds 193 states have abolished or ceased to carry out the punishment .
original: The struggle against capital punishment have been successful but only 100 of the worlds 193 countries have abolished or ceased to carry out the punishment.

obfuscation: Sweden abolished the capital punishment in the year 1921 .
original: Sweden abolished the capital punishment in the year 1921.

obfuscation: But several surveys in the last couple of years have shocked me and I also believe many others .
original: But several surveys in the last couple of years have shocked me and I also believe many others.

obfuscation: Because the surveys show that an increasing number of people , and particularly young persons , can consider to reintroduce the capital punishment .
original: Because the surveys show that an increasing number of people, and especially young persons, can consider to reintroduce the capital punishment.

obfuscation: I remember this is terrible and very frightening , and I hope this essay will show you why .
original: I think this is terrible and very frightening, and I hope this essay will show you why.

obfuscation: The right to life is the about fundamental part of the Human Rights Agenda .
original: The right to life is the most fundamental part of the Human Rights Agenda.

obfuscation: To claim the right to life for innocent people is not very unmanageable .
original: To claim the right to life for innocent people is not very difficult.

obfuscation: It goes without saying .
original: It goes without saying.

obfuscation: It is well harder to defend people with horrible crimes on their consciences ; mass-murderers , war criminals , paedophiles etc .
original: It is considerably harder to defend people with horrible crimes on their consciences; mass-murderers, war criminals, paedophiles etc.

obfuscation: But that is how universal rights works .
original: But that is how universal rights works.

obfuscation: They applies to everyone , everywhere and during all circumstances .
original: They applies to everyone, everywhere and during all circumstances.

obfuscation: Argument from the point of view of usefulness , for example that one end of a mass-murderer is better than the future death of ten victims , ignores the most fundamental value - that killing is wrong .
original: Argument from the point of view of usefulness, for example that one death of a mass-murderer is better than the future death of ten victims, ignores the most fundamental value - that killing is wrong.

obfuscation: Since killing is wrong , the fact that some States ' laws recommend public murders to prevent their citizens to commit murder , seems absurd and full of contradictions .
original: Since killing is wrong, the fact that some States' laws recommend public murders to prevent their citizens to commit murder, seems absurd and full of contradictions.

obfuscation: How can you show that killing is wrong and try to administer justice by killing ?
original: How can you show that killing is wrong and try to administer justice by killing?

obfuscation: It is totally impossible to achieve justice by killing another person .
original: It is totally impossible to achieve justice by killing another person.

obfuscation: And there is nothing that indicates that the capital punishment prevents criminality .
original: And there is nothing that indicates that the capital punishment prevents criminality.

obfuscation: The crimes of violence follow a curve that is due to social and economical factors at a certain point of time .
original: The crimes of violence follow a curve that is due to social and economical factors at a certain point of time.

obfuscation: It is also independent of if the capital punishment exists or is abolished .
original: It is also independent of if the capital punishment exists or is abolished.

obfuscation: Since the capital punishment was abolished in Canada has for example the brutal crimes decreased .
original: Since the capital punishment was abolished in Canada has for example the brutal crimes decreased.

obfuscation: But it has increased in the American states where it has been reintroduced .
original: But it has increased in the American states where it has been reintroduced.

obfuscation: In all parts of the world this is a punishment that mostly affects the poor people , minorities and early oppressed or already outcasts of society .
original: In all parts of the world this is a punishment that mostly affects the poor people, minorities and other oppressed or already outcasts of society.

obfuscation: An execution of a human being is an act that is known to have a brutalising effect .
original: An execution of a human being is an act that is known to have a brutalising effect.

obfuscation: The capital punishment has therefore a negative influence on the people in the society where it is used .
original: The capital punishment has therefore a negative influence on the people in the society where it is used.

obfuscation: If the State consider themselves capable of killing a person in their custody , early people can interpret the killing as something accepted and right in its connection .
original: If the State consider themselves capable of killing a person in their custody, other people can interpret the killing as something accepted and right in its connection.

obfuscation: Another argument , which speaks for itself to abolish the capitol punishment , is that every year a number of totally innocent people are executed .
original: Another argument, which speaks for itself to abolish the capitol punishment, is that every year a number of totally innocent people are executed.

obfuscation: That is mostly due to meagre and incorrect trials .
original: That is mostly due to meagre and incorrect trials.

obfuscation: My opinion is that this can never be aloud to happen .
original: My opinion is that this can never be aloud to happen.

obfuscation: But it does , obviously , and an abolishment of the capital punishment is the alone way to avoid it .
original: But it does, obviously, and an abolishment of the capital punishment is the only way to avoid it.

obfuscation: The capital punishment is the ultimate form of torture .
original: The capital punishment is the ultimate form of torture.

obfuscation: It gives the absolute power to a few men and women to decide if a person will live or not .
original: It gives the absolute power to a few men and women to decide if a person will live or not.

obfuscation: That kind of power can not be accepted in a democracy .
original: That kind of power can not be accepted in a democracy.

obfuscation: It is the same thing with the right to stop an execution .
original: It is the same thing with the right to stop an execution.

obfuscation: That power often lies in the hands of only one person that make n't need to answer for the decision to anyone .
original: That power often lies in the hands of only one person that don't need to answer for the decision to anyone.

obfuscation: The capital punishment is irreconcilable with the Human Rights .
original: The capital punishment is irreconcilable with the Human Rights.

obfuscation: It is also unnecessary and totally unacceptable in a state governed by law , specially a democracy .
original: It is also unnecessary and totally unacceptable in a state governed by law, especially a democracy.

obfuscation: To speak for abolishing the capital punishment is not to accept cruel crimes .
original: To speak for abolishing the capital punishment is not to accept cruel crimes.

obfuscation: It is to say no to deadly violence , even the killing that takes place in the name of the law .
original: It is to say no to deadly violence, even the killing that takes place in the name of the law.

obfuscation: I remember , as I hope this essay have shown , that the capital punishment violates every person 's right to live .
original: I think, as I hope this essay have shown, that the capital punishment violates every person's right to live.

obfuscation: And I think it is an ancient means of punishment , I like to think that mankind has developed .
original: And I think it is an ancient way of punishment, I like to think that mankind has developed.

obfuscation: The question is if I should have the same view of the matter if somebody would kill a member of my family or one of my close friends .
original: The question is if I should have the same view of the matter if somebody would kill a member of my family or one of my close friends.

obfuscation: I hope I will never find away .
original: I hope I will never find out.
